00089 void ldlm_convert_policy_to_wire(enum ldlm_type type,
00090                                  const union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy,
00091                                  union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy)
00092 {
00093         ldlm_policy_local_to_wire_t convert;
00094 
00095         convert = ldlm_policy_local_to_wire[type - LDLM_MIN_TYPE];
00096 
00097         convert(lpolicy, wpolicy);
00098 }

00103 void ldlm_convert_policy_to_local(struct obd_export *exp, enum ldlm_type type,

00114 const char *ldlm_it2str(enum ldlm_intent_flags it)
00115 {
00116         switch (it) {
00117         case IT_OPEN:
00118                 return "open";
00119         case IT_CREAT:
00120                 return "creat";
00121         case (IT_OPEN | IT_CREAT):
00122                 return "open|creat";
00123         case IT_READDIR:
00124                 return "readdir";
00125         case IT_GETATTR:
00126                 return "getattr";
00127         case IT_LOOKUP:
00128                 return "lookup";
00129         case IT_UNLINK:
00130                 return "unlink";
00131         case IT_GETXATTR:
00132                 return "getxattr";
00133         case IT_LAYOUT:
00134                 return "layout";
00135         default:
00136                 CERROR("Unknown intent 0x%08x\n", it);
00137                 return "UNKNOWN";
00138         }
00139 }
00140 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_it2str);

00178 struct ldlm_lock *ldlm_lock_get(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00179 {
00180         atomic_inc(&lock->l_refc);
00181         return lock;
00182 }
00183 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_get);
00184 
00190 void ldlm_lock_put(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00191 {
00192         ENTRY;
00193 
00194         LASSERT(lock->l_resource != LP_POISON);
00195         LASSERT(atomic_read(&lock->l_refc) > 0);
00196         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&lock->l_refc)) {
00197                 struct ldlm_resource *res;
00198 
00199                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock,
00200                            "final lock_put on destroyed lock, freeing it.");
00201 
00202                 res = lock->l_resource;
00203                 LASSERT(ldlm_is_destroyed(lock));
00204                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_exp_list));
00205                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_res_link));
00206                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_pending_chain));
00207 
00208                 lprocfs_counter_decr(ldlm_res_to_ns(res)->ns_stats,
00209                                      LDLM_NSS_LOCKS);
00210                 lu_ref_del(&res->lr_reference, "lock", lock);
00211                 ldlm_resource_putref(res);
00212                 lock->l_resource = NULL;
00213                 if (lock->l_export) {
00214                         class_export_lock_put(lock->l_export, lock);
00215                         lock->l_export = NULL;
00216                 }
00217 
00218                 if (lock->l_lvb_data != NULL)
00219                         OBD_FREE_LARGE(lock->l_lvb_data, lock->l_lvb_len);
00220 
00221                 ldlm_interval_free(ldlm_interval_detach(lock));
00222                 lu_ref_fini(&lock->l_reference);
00223                 OBD_FREE_RCU(lock, sizeof(*lock), &lock->l_handle);
00224         }
00225 
00226         EXIT;
00227 }
00228 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_put);
00229 
00233 int ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru_nolock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00234 {
00235         int rc = 0;
00236         if (!list_empty(&lock->l_lru)) {
00237                 struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
00238 
00239                 LASSERT(lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_FLOCK);
00240                 list_del_init(&lock->l_lru);
00241                 LASSERT(ns->ns_nr_unused > 0);
00242                 ns->ns_nr_unused--;
00243                 rc = 1;
00244         }
00245         return rc;
00246 }
00247 
00259 int ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru_check(struct ldlm_lock *lock, cfs_time_t last_use)
00260 {
00261         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
00262         int rc = 0;
00263 
00264         ENTRY;
00265         if (ldlm_is_ns_srv(lock)) {
00266                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_lru));
00267                 RETURN(0);
00268         }
00269 
00270         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
00271         if (last_use == 0 || last_use == lock->l_last_used)
00272                 rc = ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru_nolock(lock);
00273         spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
00274 
00275         RETURN(rc);
00276 }
00277 
00281 void ldlm_lock_add_to_lru_nolock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00282 {
00283         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
00284 
00285         lock->l_last_used = cfs_time_current();
00286         LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_lru));
00287         LASSERT(lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_FLOCK);
00288         list_add_tail(&lock->l_lru, &ns->ns_unused_list);
00289         ldlm_clear_skipped(lock);
00290         LASSERT(ns->ns_nr_unused >= 0);
00291         ns->ns_nr_unused++;
00292 }
00293 
00298 void ldlm_lock_add_to_lru(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00299 {
00300         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
00301 
00302         ENTRY;
00303         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
00304         ldlm_lock_add_to_lru_nolock(lock);
00305         spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
00306         EXIT;
00307 }
00308 
00313 void ldlm_lock_touch_in_lru(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00314 {
00315         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
00316 
00317         ENTRY;
00318         if (ldlm_is_ns_srv(lock)) {
00319                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_lru));
00320                 EXIT;
00321                 return;
00322         }
00323 
00324         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
00325         if (!list_empty(&lock->l_lru)) {
00326                 ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru_nolock(lock);
00327                 ldlm_lock_add_to_lru_nolock(lock);
00328         }
00329         spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
00330         EXIT;
00331 }
00332 
00352 static int ldlm_lock_destroy_internal(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00353 {
00354         ENTRY;
00355 
00356         if (lock->l_readers || lock->l_writers) {
00357                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock still has references");
00358                 LBUG();
00359         }
00360 
00361         if (!list_empty(&lock->l_res_link)) {
00362                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock still on resource");
00363                 LBUG();
00364         }
00365 
00366         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00367                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_lru));
00368                 EXIT;
00369                 return 0;
00370         }
00371         ldlm_set_destroyed(lock);
00372 
00373         if (lock->l_export && lock->l_export->exp_lock_hash) {
00374                 /* NB: it's safe to call cfs_hash_del() even lock isn't
00375                  * in exp_lock_hash. */
00376                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
00377                  * ldlm_export_lock_keycmp() */
00378                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
00379                 cfs_hash_del(lock->l_export->exp_lock_hash,
00380                              &lock->l_remote_handle, &lock->l_exp_hash);
00381         }
00382 
00383         ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru(lock);
00384         class_handle_unhash(&lock->l_handle);
00385 
00386 #if 0
00387         /* Wake anyone waiting for this lock */
00388         /* FIXME: I should probably add yet another flag, instead of using
00389          * l_export to only call this on clients */
00390         if (lock->l_export)
00391                 class_export_put(lock->l_export);
00392         lock->l_export = NULL;
00393         if (lock->l_export && lock->l_completion_ast)
00394                 lock->l_completion_ast(lock, 0);
00395 #endif
00396         EXIT;
00397         return 1;
00398 }
00399 
00403 void ldlm_lock_destroy(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00404 {
00405         int first;
00406         ENTRY;
00407         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00408         first = ldlm_lock_destroy_internal(lock);
00409         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00410 
00411         /* drop reference from hashtable only for first destroy */
00412         if (first) {
00413                 lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, "hash", lock);
00414                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00415         }
00416         EXIT;
00417 }
00418 
00422 void ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00423 {
00424         int first;
00425         ENTRY;
00426         first = ldlm_lock_destroy_internal(lock);
00427         /* drop reference from hashtable only for first destroy */
00428         if (first) {
00429                 lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, "hash", lock);
00430                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00431         }
00432         EXIT;
00433 }
00434 
00435 /* this is called by portals_handle2object with the handle lock taken */
00436 static void lock_handle_addref(void *lock)
00437 {
00438         LDLM_LOCK_GET((struct ldlm_lock *)lock);
00439 }
00440 
00441 static void lock_handle_free(void *lock, int size)
00442 {
00443         LASSERT(size == sizeof(struct ldlm_lock));
00444         OBD_SLAB_FREE(lock, ldlm_lock_slab, size);
00445 }
00446 
00447 static struct portals_handle_ops lock_handle_ops = {
00448         .hop_addref = lock_handle_addref,
00449         .hop_free   = lock_handle_free,
00450 };
00451 
00460 static struct ldlm_lock *ldlm_lock_new(struct ldlm_resource *resource)
00461 {
00462         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00463         ENTRY;
00464 
00465         if (resource == NULL)
00466                 LBUG();
00467 
00468         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(lock, ldlm_lock_slab, GFP_NOFS);
00469         if (lock == NULL)
00470                 RETURN(NULL);
00471 
00472         spin_lock_init(&lock->l_lock);
00473         lock->l_resource = resource;
00474         lu_ref_add(&resource->lr_reference, "lock", lock);
00475 
00476         atomic_set(&lock->l_refc, 2);
00477         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_res_link);
00478         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_lru);
00479         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_pending_chain);
00480         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_bl_ast);
00481         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_cp_ast);
00482         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_rk_ast);
00483         init_waitqueue_head(&lock->l_waitq);
00484         lock->l_blocking_lock = NULL;
00485         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_sl_mode);
00486         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_sl_policy);
00487         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&lock->l_exp_hash);
00488         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&lock->l_exp_flock_hash);
00489 
00490         lprocfs_counter_incr(ldlm_res_to_ns(resource)->ns_stats,
00491                              LDLM_NSS_LOCKS);
00492         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_handle.h_link);
00493         class_handle_hash(&lock->l_handle, &lock_handle_ops);
00494 
00495         lu_ref_init(&lock->l_reference);
00496         lu_ref_add(&lock->l_reference, "hash", lock);
00497         lock->l_callback_timeout = 0;
00498 
00499 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
00500         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_exp_refs_link);
00501         lock->l_exp_refs_nr = 0;
00502         lock->l_exp_refs_target = NULL;
00503 #endif
00504         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->l_exp_list);
00505 
00506         RETURN(lock);
00507 }
00508 
00514 int ldlm_lock_change_resource(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00515                               const struct ldlm_res_id *new_resid)
00516 {
00517         struct ldlm_resource *oldres = lock->l_resource;
00518         struct ldlm_resource *newres;
00519         int type;
00520         ENTRY;
00521 
00522         LASSERT(ns_is_client(ns));
00523 
00524         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00525         if (memcmp(new_resid, &lock->l_resource->lr_name,
00526                    sizeof(lock->l_resource->lr_name)) == 0) {
00527                 /* Nothing to do */
00528                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00529                 RETURN(0);
00530         }
00531 
00532         LASSERT(new_resid->name[0] != 0);
00533 
00534         /* This function assumes that the lock isn't on any lists */
00535         LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_res_link));
00536 
00537         type = oldres->lr_type;
00538         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00539 
00540         newres = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, new_resid, type, 1);
00541         if (IS_ERR(newres))
00542                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(newres));
00543 
00544         lu_ref_add(&newres->lr_reference, "lock", lock);
00545         /*
00546          * To flip the lock from the old to the new resource, lock, oldres and
00547          * newres have to be locked. Resource spin-locks are nested within
00548          * lock->l_lock, and are taken in the memory address order to avoid
00549          * dead-locks.
00550          */
00551         spin_lock(&lock->l_lock);
00552         oldres = lock->l_resource;
00553         if (oldres < newres) {
00554                 lock_res(oldres);
00555                 lock_res_nested(newres, LRT_NEW);
00556         } else {
00557                 lock_res(newres);
00558                 lock_res_nested(oldres, LRT_NEW);
00559         }
00560         LASSERT(memcmp(new_resid, &oldres->lr_name,
00561                        sizeof oldres->lr_name) != 0);
00562         lock->l_resource = newres;
00563         unlock_res(oldres);
00564         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00565 
00566         /* ...and the flowers are still standing! */
00567         lu_ref_del(&oldres->lr_reference, "lock", lock);
00568         ldlm_resource_putref(oldres);
00569 
00570         RETURN(0);
00571 }
00572 
00582 void ldlm_lock2handle(const struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct lustre_handle *lockh)
00583 {
00584         lockh->cookie = lock->l_handle.h_cookie;
00585 }
00586 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock2handle);
00587 
00594 struct ldlm_lock *__ldlm_handle2lock(const struct lustre_handle *handle,
00595                                      __u64 flags)
00596 {
00597         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00598         ENTRY;
00599 
00600         LASSERT(handle);
00601 
00602         lock = class_handle2object(handle->cookie, NULL);
00603         if (lock == NULL)
00604                 RETURN(NULL);
00605 
00606         /* It's unlikely but possible that someone marked the lock as
00607          * destroyed after we did handle2object on it */
00608         if ((flags == 0) && !ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00609                 lu_ref_add(&lock->l_reference, "handle", current);
00610                 RETURN(lock);
00611         }
00612 
00613         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00614 
00615         LASSERT(lock->l_resource != NULL);
00616 
00617         lu_ref_add_atomic(&lock->l_reference, "handle", current);
00618         if (unlikely(ldlm_is_destroyed(lock))) {
00619                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00620                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lock already destroyed: lock %p\n", lock);
00621                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00622                 RETURN(NULL);
00623         }
00624 
00625         /* If we're setting flags, make sure none of them are already set. */
00626         if (flags != 0) {
00627                 if ((lock->l_flags & flags) != 0) {
00628                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00629                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00630                         RETURN(NULL);
00631                 }
00632 
00633                 lock->l_flags |= flags;
00634         }
00635 
00636         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00637         RETURN(lock);
00638 }
00639 EXPORT_SYMBOL(__ldlm_handle2lock);
00646 void ldlm_lock2desc(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc)
00647 {
00648         ldlm_res2desc(lock->l_resource, &desc->l_resource);
00649         desc->l_req_mode = lock->l_req_mode;
00650         desc->l_granted_mode = lock->l_granted_mode;
00651         ldlm_convert_policy_to_wire(lock->l_resource->lr_type,
00652                                     &lock->l_policy_data,
00653                                     &desc->l_policy_data);
00654 }
00655 
00661 static void ldlm_add_bl_work_item(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock *new,
00662                                   struct list_head *work_list)
00663 {
00664         if (!ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock)) {
00665                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "lock incompatible; sending blocking AST.");
00666                 ldlm_set_ast_sent(lock);
00667                 /* If the enqueuing client said so, tell the AST recipient to
00668                  * discard dirty data, rather than writing back. */
00669                 if (ldlm_is_ast_discard_data(new))
00670                         ldlm_set_discard_data(lock);
00671                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_bl_ast));
00672                 list_add(&lock->l_bl_ast, work_list);
00673                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00674                 LASSERT(lock->l_blocking_lock == NULL);
00675                 lock->l_blocking_lock = LDLM_LOCK_GET(new);
00676         }
00677 }
00678 
00682 static void ldlm_add_cp_work_item(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00683                                   struct list_head *work_list)
00684 {
00685         if (!ldlm_is_cp_reqd(lock)) {
00686                 ldlm_set_cp_reqd(lock);
00687                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "lock granted; sending completion AST.");
00688                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_cp_ast));
00689                 list_add(&lock->l_cp_ast, work_list);
00690                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00691         }
00692 }
00693 
00700 void ldlm_add_ast_work_item(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock *new,
00701                             struct list_head *work_list)
00702 {
00703         ENTRY;
00704         check_res_locked(lock->l_resource);
00705         if (new)
00706                 ldlm_add_bl_work_item(lock, new, work_list);
00707         else
00708                 ldlm_add_cp_work_item(lock, work_list);
00709         EXIT;
00710 }
00711 
00717 void ldlm_lock_addref(const struct lustre_handle *lockh, enum ldlm_mode mode)
00718 {
00719         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00720 
00721         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00722         LASSERTF(lock != NULL, "Non-existing lock: "LPX64"\n", lockh->cookie);
00723         ldlm_lock_addref_internal(lock, mode);
00724         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00725 }
00726 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_addref);
00727 
00735 void ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00736                                       enum ldlm_mode mode)
00737 {
00738         ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru(lock);
00739         if (mode & (LCK_NL | LCK_CR | LCK_PR)) {
00740                 lock->l_readers++;
00741                 lu_ref_add_atomic(&lock->l_reference, "reader", lock);
00742         }
00743         if (mode & (LCK_EX | LCK_CW | LCK_PW | LCK_GROUP | LCK_COS)) {
00744                 lock->l_writers++;
00745                 lu_ref_add_atomic(&lock->l_reference, "writer", lock);
00746         }
00747         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00748         lu_ref_add_atomic(&lock->l_reference, "user", lock);
00749         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "ldlm_lock_addref(%s)", ldlm_lockname[mode]);
00750 }
00751 
00760 int ldlm_lock_addref_try(const struct lustre_handle *lockh, enum ldlm_mode mode)
00761 {
00762         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00763         int               result;
00764 
00765         result = -EAGAIN;
00766         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00767         if (lock != NULL) {
00768                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00769                 if (lock->l_readers != 0 || lock->l_writers != 0 ||
00770                     !ldlm_is_cbpending(lock)) {
00771                         ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
00772                         result = 0;
00773                 }
00774                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00775                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00776         }
00777         return result;
00778 }
00779 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_addref_try);
00780 
00786 void ldlm_lock_addref_internal(struct ldlm_lock *lock, enum ldlm_mode mode)
00787 {
00788         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00789         ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
00790         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00791 }
00792 
00800 void ldlm_lock_decref_internal_nolock(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00801                                       enum ldlm_mode mode)
00802 {
00803         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "ldlm_lock_decref(%s)", ldlm_lockname[mode]);
00804         if (mode & (LCK_NL | LCK_CR | LCK_PR)) {
00805                 LASSERT(lock->l_readers > 0);
00806                 lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, "reader", lock);
00807                 lock->l_readers--;
00808         }
00809         if (mode & (LCK_EX | LCK_CW | LCK_PW | LCK_GROUP | LCK_COS)) {
00810                 LASSERT(lock->l_writers > 0);
00811                 lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, "writer", lock);
00812                 lock->l_writers--;
00813         }
00814 
00815         lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, "user", lock);
00816         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);    /* matches the LDLM_LOCK_GET() in addref */
00817 }
00818 
00827 void ldlm_lock_decref_internal(struct ldlm_lock *lock, enum ldlm_mode mode)
00828 {
00829         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
00830         ENTRY;
00831 
00832         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00833 
00834         ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
00835 
00836         ldlm_lock_decref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
00837 
00838         if ((ldlm_is_local(lock) || lock->l_req_mode == LCK_GROUP) &&
00839             !lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers) {
00840                 /* If this is a local lock on a server namespace and this was
00841                  * the last reference, cancel the lock.
00842                  *
00843                  * Group locks are special:
00844                  * They must not go in LRU, but they are not called back
00845                  * like non-group locks, instead they are manually released.
00846                  * They have an l_writers reference which they keep until
00847                  * they are manually released, so we remove them when they have
00848                  * no more reader or writer references. - LU-6368 */
00849                 ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
00850         }
00851 
00852         if (!lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers && ldlm_is_cbpending(lock)) {
00853                 /* If we received a blocked AST and this was the last reference,
00854                  * run the callback. */
00855                 if (ldlm_is_ns_srv(lock) && lock->l_export)
00856                         CERROR("FL_CBPENDING set on non-local lock--just a "
00857                                "warning\n");
00858 
00859                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "final decref done on cbpending lock");
00860 
00861                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock); /* dropped by bl thread */
00862                 ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru(lock);
00863                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00864 
00865                 if (ldlm_is_fail_loc(lock))
00866                         OBD_RACE(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_BL_RACE);
00867 
00868                 if (ldlm_is_atomic_cb(lock) ||
00869                     ldlm_bl_to_thread_lock(ns, NULL, lock) != 0)
00870                         ldlm_handle_bl_callback(ns, NULL, lock);
00871         } else if (ns_is_client(ns) &&
00872                    !lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers &&
00873                    !ldlm_is_no_lru(lock) &&
00874                    !ldlm_is_bl_ast(lock)) {
00875 
00876                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "add lock into lru list");
00877 
00878                 /* If this is a client-side namespace and this was the last
00879                  * reference, put it on the LRU. */
00880                 ldlm_lock_add_to_lru(lock);
00881                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00882 
00883                 if (ldlm_is_fail_loc(lock))
00884                         OBD_RACE(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_BL_RACE);
00885 
00886                 /* Call ldlm_cancel_lru() only if EARLY_CANCEL and LRU RESIZE
00887                  * are not supported by the server, otherwise, it is done on
00888                  * enqueue. */
00889                 if (!exp_connect_cancelset(lock->l_conn_export) &&
00890                     !ns_connect_lru_resize(ns))
00891                         ldlm_cancel_lru(ns, 0, LCF_ASYNC, 0);
00892         } else {
00893                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "do not add lock into lru list");
00894                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00895         }
00896 
00897         EXIT;
00898 }
00899 
00903 void ldlm_lock_decref(const struct lustre_handle *lockh, enum ldlm_mode mode)
00904 {
00905         struct ldlm_lock *lock = __ldlm_handle2lock(lockh, 0);
00906         LASSERTF(lock != NULL, "Non-existing lock: "LPX64"\n", lockh->cookie);
00907         ldlm_lock_decref_internal(lock, mode);
00908         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00909 }
00910 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_decref);
00911 
00918 void ldlm_lock_decref_and_cancel(const struct lustre_handle *lockh,
00919                                  enum ldlm_mode mode)
00920 {
00921         struct ldlm_lock *lock = __ldlm_handle2lock(lockh, 0);
00922         ENTRY;
00923 
00924         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00925 
00926         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "ldlm_lock_decref(%s)", ldlm_lockname[mode]);
00927         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00928         ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
00929         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00930         ldlm_lock_decref_internal(lock, mode);
00931         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00932 }
00933 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_decref_and_cancel);
00934 
00935 struct sl_insert_point {
00936         struct list_head *res_link;
00937         struct list_head *mode_link;
00938         struct list_head *policy_link;
00939 };
00940 
00955 static void search_granted_lock(struct list_head *queue,
00956                                 struct ldlm_lock *req,
00957                                 struct sl_insert_point *prev)
00958 {
00959         struct list_head *tmp;
00960         struct ldlm_lock *lock, *mode_end, *policy_end;
00961         ENTRY;
00962 
00963         list_for_each(tmp, queue) {
00964                 lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
00965 
00966                 mode_end = list_entry(lock->l_sl_mode.prev,
00967                                           struct ldlm_lock, l_sl_mode);
00968 
00969                 if (lock->l_req_mode != req->l_req_mode) {
00970                         /* jump to last lock of mode group */
00971                         tmp = &mode_end->l_res_link;
00972                         continue;
00973                 }
00974 
00975                 /* suitable mode group is found */
00976                 if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN) {
00977                         /* insert point is last lock of the mode group */
00978                         prev->res_link = &mode_end->l_res_link;
00979                         prev->mode_link = &mode_end->l_sl_mode;
00980                         prev->policy_link = &req->l_sl_policy;
00981                         EXIT;
00982                         return;
00983                 } else if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_IBITS) {
00984                         for (;;) {
00985                                 policy_end =
00986                                         list_entry(lock->l_sl_policy.prev,
00987                                                        struct ldlm_lock,
00988                                                        l_sl_policy);
00989 
00990                                 if (lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits ==
00991                                     req->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits) {
00992                                         /* insert point is last lock of
00993                                          * the policy group */
00994                                         prev->res_link =
00995                                                 &policy_end->l_res_link;
00996                                         prev->mode_link =
00997                                                 &policy_end->l_sl_mode;
00998                                         prev->policy_link =
00999                                                 &policy_end->l_sl_policy;
01000                                         EXIT;
01001                                         return;
01002                                 }
01003 
01004                                 if (policy_end == mode_end)
01005                                         /* done with mode group */
01006                                         break;
01007 
01008                                 /* go to next policy group within mode group */
01009                                 tmp = policy_end->l_res_link.next;
01010                                 lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock,
01011                                                       l_res_link);
01012                         }  /* loop over policy groups within the mode group */
01013 
01014                         /* insert point is last lock of the mode group,
01015                          * new policy group is started */
01016                         prev->res_link = &mode_end->l_res_link;
01017                         prev->mode_link = &mode_end->l_sl_mode;
01018                         prev->policy_link = &req->l_sl_policy;
01019                         EXIT;
01020                         return;
01021                 } else {
01022                         LDLM_ERROR(lock,"is not LDLM_PLAIN or LDLM_IBITS lock");
01023                         LBUG();
01024                 }
01025         }
01026 
01027         /* insert point is last lock on the queue,
01028          * new mode group and new policy group are started */
01029         prev->res_link = queue->prev;
01030         prev->mode_link = &req->l_sl_mode;
01031         prev->policy_link = &req->l_sl_policy;
01032         EXIT;
01033         return;
01034 }
01035 
01040 static void ldlm_granted_list_add_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01041                                        struct sl_insert_point *prev)
01042 {
01043         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
01044         ENTRY;
01045 
01046         check_res_locked(res);
01047 
01048         ldlm_resource_dump(D_INFO, res);
01049         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "About to add lock:");
01050 
01051         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
01052                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "Lock destroyed, not adding to resource\n");
01053                 return;
01054         }
01055 
01056         LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_res_link));
01057         LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_sl_mode));
01058         LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_sl_policy));
01059 
01060         /*
01061          * lock->link == prev->link means lock is first starting the group.
01062          * Don't re-add to itself to suppress kernel warnings.
01063          */
01064         if (&lock->l_res_link != prev->res_link)
01065                 list_add(&lock->l_res_link, prev->res_link);
01066         if (&lock->l_sl_mode != prev->mode_link)
01067                 list_add(&lock->l_sl_mode, prev->mode_link);
01068         if (&lock->l_sl_policy != prev->policy_link)
01069                 list_add(&lock->l_sl_policy, prev->policy_link);
01070 
01071         EXIT;
01072 }
01073 
01078 static void ldlm_grant_lock_with_skiplist(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01079 {
01080         struct sl_insert_point prev;
01081         ENTRY;
01082 
01083         LASSERT(lock->l_req_mode == lock->l_granted_mode);
01084 
01085         search_granted_lock(&lock->l_resource->lr_granted, lock, &prev);
01086         ldlm_granted_list_add_lock(lock, &prev);
01087         EXIT;
01088 }
01089 
01101 void ldlm_grant_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct list_head *work_list)
01102 {
01103         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
01104         ENTRY;
01105 
01106         check_res_locked(res);
01107 
01108         lock->l_granted_mode = lock->l_req_mode;
01109 
01110         if (work_list && lock->l_completion_ast != NULL)
01111                 ldlm_add_ast_work_item(lock, NULL, work_list);
01112 
01113         /* We should not add locks to granted list in the following cases:
01114          * - this is an UNLOCK but not a real lock;
01115          * - this is a TEST lock;
01116          * - this is a F_CANCELLK lock (async flock has req_mode == 0)
01117          * - this is a deadlock (flock cannot be granted) */
01118         if (lock->l_req_mode == 0 ||
01119             lock->l_req_mode == LCK_NL ||
01120             ldlm_is_test_lock(lock) ||
01121             ldlm_is_flock_deadlock(lock))
01122                 RETURN_EXIT;
01123 
01124         if (res->lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN || res->lr_type == LDLM_IBITS)
01125                 ldlm_grant_lock_with_skiplist(lock);
01126         else if (res->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)
01127                 ldlm_extent_add_lock(res, lock);
01128         else
01129                 ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_granted, lock);
01130 
01131         ldlm_pool_add(&ldlm_res_to_ns(res)->ns_pool, lock);
01132         EXIT;
01133 }
01134 
01138 struct lock_match_data {
01139         struct ldlm_lock        *lmd_old;
01140         struct ldlm_lock        *lmd_lock;
01141         enum ldlm_mode          *lmd_mode;
01142         union ldlm_policy_data  *lmd_policy;
01143         __u64                    lmd_flags;
01144         int                      lmd_unref;
01145 };
01146 
01154 static int lock_matches(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct lock_match_data *data)
01155 {
01156         union ldlm_policy_data *lpol = &lock->l_policy_data;
01157         enum ldlm_mode match;
01158 
01159         if (lock == data->lmd_old)
01160                 return INTERVAL_ITER_STOP;
01161 
01162         /* Check if this lock can be matched.
01163          * Used by LU-2919(exclusive open) for open lease lock */
01164         if (ldlm_is_excl(lock))
01165                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01166 
01167         /* llite sometimes wants to match locks that will be
01168          * canceled when their users drop, but we allow it to match
01169          * if it passes in CBPENDING and the lock still has users.
01170          * this is generally only going to be used by children
01171          * whose parents already hold a lock so forward progress
01172          * can still happen. */
01173         if (ldlm_is_cbpending(lock) &&
01174             !(data->lmd_flags & LDLM_FL_CBPENDING))
01175                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01176         if (!data->lmd_unref && ldlm_is_cbpending(lock) &&
01177             lock->l_readers == 0 && lock->l_writers == 0)
01178                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01179 
01180         if (!(lock->l_req_mode & *data->lmd_mode))
01181                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01182         match = lock->l_req_mode;
01183 
01184         switch (lock->l_resource->lr_type) {
01185         case LDLM_EXTENT:
01186                 if (lpol->l_extent.start > data->lmd_policy->l_extent.start ||
01187                     lpol->l_extent.end < data->lmd_policy->l_extent.end)
01188                         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01189 
01190                 if (unlikely(match == LCK_GROUP) &&
01191                     data->lmd_policy->l_extent.gid != LDLM_GID_ANY &&
01192                     lpol->l_extent.gid != data->lmd_policy->l_extent.gid)
01193                         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01194                 break;
01195         case LDLM_IBITS:
01196                 /* We match if we have existing lock with same or wider set
01197                    of bits. */
01198                 if ((lpol->l_inodebits.bits &
01199                      data->lmd_policy->l_inodebits.bits) !=
01200                     data->lmd_policy->l_inodebits.bits)
01201                         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01202                 break;
01203         default:
01204                 ;
01205         }
01206 
01207         /* We match if we have existing lock with same or wider set
01208            of bits. */
01209         if (!data->lmd_unref && LDLM_HAVE_MASK(lock, GONE))
01210                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01211 
01212         if (!equi(data->lmd_flags & LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY, ldlm_is_local(lock)))
01213                 return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01214 
01215         if (data->lmd_flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK) {
01216                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
01217                 ldlm_lock_touch_in_lru(lock);
01218         } else {
01219                 ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(lock, match);
01220         }
01221 
01222         *data->lmd_mode = match;
01223         data->lmd_lock = lock;
01224 
01225         return INTERVAL_ITER_STOP;
01226 }
01227 
01228 static unsigned int itree_overlap_cb(struct interval_node *in, void *args)
01229 {
01230         struct ldlm_interval *node = to_ldlm_interval(in);
01231         struct lock_match_data *data = args;
01232         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01233         int rc;
01234 
01235         list_for_each_entry(lock, &node->li_group, l_sl_policy) {
01236                 rc = lock_matches(lock, data);
01237                 if (rc == INTERVAL_ITER_STOP)
01238                         return INTERVAL_ITER_STOP;
01239         }
01240         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
01241 }
01242 
01251 static struct ldlm_lock *search_itree(struct ldlm_resource *res,
01252                                       struct lock_match_data *data)
01253 {
01254         struct interval_node_extent ext = {
01255                 .start     = data->lmd_policy->l_extent.start,
01256                 .end       = data->lmd_policy->l_extent.end
01257         };
01258         int idx;
01259 
01260         for (idx = 0; idx < LCK_MODE_NUM; idx++) {
01261                 struct ldlm_interval_tree *tree = &res->lr_itree[idx];
01262 
01263                 if (tree->lit_root == NULL)
01264                         continue;
01265 
01266                 if (!(tree->lit_mode & *data->lmd_mode))
01267                         continue;
01268 
01269                 interval_search(tree->lit_root, &ext,
01270                                 itree_overlap_cb, data);
01271         }
01272         return data->lmd_lock;
01273 }
01274 
01275 
01284 static struct ldlm_lock *search_queue(struct list_head *queue,
01285                                       struct lock_match_data *data)
01286 {
01287         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01288         int rc;
01289 
01290         list_for_each_entry(lock, queue, l_res_link) {
01291                 rc = lock_matches(lock, data);
01292                 if (rc == INTERVAL_ITER_STOP)
01293                         return data->lmd_lock;
01294         }
01295         return NULL;
01296 }
01297 
01298 void ldlm_lock_fail_match_locked(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01299 {
01300         if ((lock->l_flags & LDLM_FL_FAIL_NOTIFIED) == 0) {
01301                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_FAIL_NOTIFIED;
01302                 wake_up_all(&lock->l_waitq);
01303         }
01304 }
01305 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_fail_match_locked);
01306 
01307 void ldlm_lock_fail_match(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01308 {
01309         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01310         ldlm_lock_fail_match_locked(lock);
01311         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01312 }
01313 
01321 void ldlm_lock_allow_match_locked(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01322 {
01323         ldlm_set_lvb_ready(lock);
01324         wake_up_all(&lock->l_waitq);
01325 }
01326 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_allow_match_locked);
01327 
01332 void ldlm_lock_allow_match(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01333 {
01334         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01335         ldlm_lock_allow_match_locked(lock);
01336         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01337 }
01338 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_allow_match);
01339 
01370 enum ldlm_mode ldlm_lock_match(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, __u64 flags,
01371                                const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
01372                                enum ldlm_type type,
01373                                union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
01374                                enum ldlm_mode mode,
01375                                struct lustre_handle *lockh, int unref)
01376 {
01377         struct lock_match_data data = {
01378                 .lmd_old        = NULL,
01379                 .lmd_lock       = NULL,
01380                 .lmd_mode       = &mode,
01381                 .lmd_policy     = policy,
01382                 .lmd_flags      = flags,
01383                 .lmd_unref      = unref,
01384         };
01385         struct ldlm_resource *res;
01386         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01387         int rc = 0;
01388         ENTRY;
01389 
01390         if (ns == NULL) {
01391                 data.lmd_old = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
01392                 LASSERT(data.lmd_old != NULL);
01393 
01394                 ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(data.lmd_old);
01395                 res_id = &data.lmd_old->l_resource->lr_name;
01396                 type = data.lmd_old->l_resource->lr_type;
01397                 *data.lmd_mode = data.lmd_old->l_req_mode;
01398         }
01399 
01400         res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, res_id, type, 0);
01401         if (IS_ERR(res)) {
01402                 LASSERT(data.lmd_old == NULL);
01403                 RETURN(0);
01404         }
01405 
01406         LDLM_RESOURCE_ADDREF(res);
01407         lock_res(res);
01408 
01409         if (res->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)
01410                 lock = search_itree(res, &data);
01411         else
01412                 lock = search_queue(&res->lr_granted, &data);
01413         if (lock != NULL)
01414                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01415         if (flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED)
01416                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01417         lock = search_queue(&res->lr_converting, &data);
01418         if (lock != NULL)
01419                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01420         lock = search_queue(&res->lr_waiting, &data);
01421         if (lock != NULL)
01422                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01423 
01424         EXIT;
01425  out:
01426         unlock_res(res);
01427         LDLM_RESOURCE_DELREF(res);
01428         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
01429 
01430         if (lock) {
01431                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, lockh);
01432                 if ((flags & LDLM_FL_LVB_READY) &&
01433                     (!ldlm_is_lvb_ready(lock))) {
01434                         __u64 wait_flags = LDLM_FL_LVB_READY |
01435                                 LDLM_FL_DESTROYED | LDLM_FL_FAIL_NOTIFIED;
01436                         struct l_wait_info lwi;
01437                         if (lock->l_completion_ast) {
01438                                 int err = lock->l_completion_ast(lock,
01439                                                           LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC,
01440                                                                  NULL);
01441                                 if (err) {
01442                                         if (flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
01443                                                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01444                                         else
01445                                                 ldlm_lock_decref_internal(lock,
01446                                                                           mode);
01447                                         rc = 0;
01448                                         goto out2;
01449                                 }
01450                         }
01451 
01452                         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_time_seconds(obd_timeout),
01453                                                NULL, LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
01454 
01455                         /* XXX FIXME see comment on CAN_MATCH in lustre_dlm.h */
01456                         l_wait_event(lock->l_waitq,
01457                                      lock->l_flags & wait_flags,
01458                                      &lwi);
01459                         if (!ldlm_is_lvb_ready(lock)) {
01460                                 if (flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
01461                                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01462                                 else
01463                                         ldlm_lock_decref_internal(lock, mode);
01464                                 rc = 0;
01465                         }
01466                 }
01467         }
01468  out2:
01469         if (rc) {
01470                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "matched ("LPU64" "LPU64")",
01471                            (type == LDLM_PLAIN || type == LDLM_IBITS) ?
01472                                 res_id->name[2] : policy->l_extent.start,
01473                            (type == LDLM_PLAIN || type == LDLM_IBITS) ?
01474                                 res_id->name[3] : policy->l_extent.end);
01475 
01476                 /* check user's security context */
01477                 if (lock->l_conn_export &&
01478                     sptlrpc_import_check_ctx(
01479                                 class_exp2cliimp(lock->l_conn_export))) {
01480                         if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK))
01481                                 ldlm_lock_decref_internal(lock, mode);
01482                         rc = 0;
01483                 }
01484 
01485                 if (flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
01486                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01487 
01488         } else if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)) {/*less verbose for test-only*/
01489                 LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("not matched ns %p type %u mode %u res "
01490                                   LPU64"/"LPU64" ("LPU64" "LPU64")", ns,
01491                                   type, mode, res_id->name[0], res_id->name[1],
01492                                   (type == LDLM_PLAIN || type == LDLM_IBITS) ?
01493                                         res_id->name[2] :policy->l_extent.start,
01494                                   (type == LDLM_PLAIN || type == LDLM_IBITS) ?
01495                                         res_id->name[3] : policy->l_extent.end);
01496         }
01497         if (data.lmd_old != NULL)
01498                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(data.lmd_old);
01499 
01500         return rc ? mode : 0;
01501 }
01502 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_match);
01503 
01504 enum ldlm_mode ldlm_revalidate_lock_handle(const struct lustre_handle *lockh,
01505                                            __u64 *bits)
01506 {
01507         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01508         enum ldlm_mode mode = 0;
01509         ENTRY;
01510 
01511         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
01512         if (lock != NULL) {
01513                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01514                 if (LDLM_HAVE_MASK(lock, GONE))
01515                         GOTO(out, mode);
01516 
01517                 if (ldlm_is_cbpending(lock) &&
01518                     lock->l_readers == 0 && lock->l_writers == 0)
01519                         GOTO(out, mode);
01520 
01521                 if (bits)
01522                         *bits = lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits;
01523                 mode = lock->l_granted_mode;
01524                 ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
01525         }
01526 
01527         EXIT;
01528 
01529 out:
01530         if (lock != NULL) {
01531                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01532                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
01533         }
01534         return mode;
01535 }
01536 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_revalidate_lock_handle);
01537 
01539 int ldlm_fill_lvb(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct req_capsule *pill,
01540                   enum req_location loc, void *data, int size)
01541 {
01542         void *lvb;
01543         ENTRY;
01544 
01545         LASSERT(data != NULL);
01546         LASSERT(size >= 0);
01547 
01548         switch (lock->l_lvb_type) {
01549         case LVB_T_OST:
01550                 if (size == sizeof(struct ost_lvb)) {
01551                         if (loc == RCL_CLIENT)
01552                                 lvb = req_capsule_client_swab_get(pill,
01553                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01554                                                 lustre_swab_ost_lvb);
01555                         else
01556                                 lvb = req_capsule_server_swab_get(pill,
01557                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01558                                                 lustre_swab_ost_lvb);
01559                         if (unlikely(lvb == NULL)) {
01560                                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "no LVB");
01561                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01562                         }
01563 
01564                         memcpy(data, lvb, size);
01565                 } else if (size == sizeof(struct ost_lvb_v1)) {
01566                         struct ost_lvb *olvb = data;
01567 
01568                         if (loc == RCL_CLIENT)
01569                                 lvb = req_capsule_client_swab_get(pill,
01570                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01571                                                 lustre_swab_ost_lvb_v1);
01572                         else
01573                                 lvb = req_capsule_server_sized_swab_get(pill,
01574                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB, size,
01575                                                 lustre_swab_ost_lvb_v1);
01576                         if (unlikely(lvb == NULL)) {
01577                                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "no LVB");
01578                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01579                         }
01580 
01581                         memcpy(data, lvb, size);
01582                         olvb->lvb_mtime_ns = 0;
01583                         olvb->lvb_atime_ns = 0;
01584                         olvb->lvb_ctime_ns = 0;
01585                 } else {
01586                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Replied unexpected ost LVB size %d",
01587                                    size);
01588                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01589                 }
01590                 break;
01591         case LVB_T_LQUOTA:
01592                 if (size == sizeof(struct lquota_lvb)) {
01593                         if (loc == RCL_CLIENT)
01594                                 lvb = req_capsule_client_swab_get(pill,
01595                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01596                                                 lustre_swab_lquota_lvb);
01597                         else
01598                                 lvb = req_capsule_server_swab_get(pill,
01599                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01600                                                 lustre_swab_lquota_lvb);
01601                         if (unlikely(lvb == NULL)) {
01602                                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "no LVB");
01603                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01604                         }
01605 
01606                         memcpy(data, lvb, size);
01607                 } else {
01608                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Replied unexpected lquota LVB size %d",
01609                                    size);
01610                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01611                 }
01612                 break;
01613         case LVB_T_LAYOUT:
01614                 if (size == 0)
01615                         break;
01616 
01617                 if (loc == RCL_CLIENT)
01618                         lvb = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB);
01619                 else
01620                         lvb = req_capsule_server_get(pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB);
01621                 if (unlikely(lvb == NULL)) {
01622                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "no LVB");
01623                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
01624                 }
01625 
01626                 memcpy(data, lvb, size);
01627                 break;
01628         default:
01629                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Unknown LVB type: %d", lock->l_lvb_type);
01630                 libcfs_debug_dumpstack(NULL);
01631                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01632         }
01633 
01634         RETURN(0);
01635 }
01636 
01641 struct ldlm_lock *ldlm_lock_create(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01642                                    const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
01643                                    enum ldlm_type type,
01644                                    enum ldlm_mode mode,
01645                                    const struct ldlm_callback_suite *cbs,
01646                                    void *data, __u32 lvb_len,
01647                                    enum lvb_type lvb_type)
01648 {
01649         struct ldlm_lock        *lock;
01650         struct ldlm_resource    *res;
01651         int                     rc;
01652         ENTRY;
01653 
01654         res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, res_id, type, 1);
01655         if (IS_ERR(res))
01656                 RETURN(ERR_CAST(res));
01657 
01658         lock = ldlm_lock_new(res);
01659         if (lock == NULL)
01660                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
01661 
01662         lock->l_req_mode = mode;
01663         lock->l_ast_data = data;
01664         lock->l_pid = current_pid();
01665         if (ns_is_server(ns))
01666                 ldlm_set_ns_srv(lock);
01667         if (cbs) {
01668                 lock->l_blocking_ast = cbs->lcs_blocking;
01669                 lock->l_completion_ast = cbs->lcs_completion;
01670                 lock->l_glimpse_ast = cbs->lcs_glimpse;
01671         }
01672 
01673         lock->l_tree_node = NULL;
01674         /* if this is the extent lock, allocate the interval tree node */
01675         if (type == LDLM_EXTENT)
01676                 if (ldlm_interval_alloc(lock) == NULL)
01677                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01678 
01679         if (lvb_len) {
01680                 lock->l_lvb_len = lvb_len;
01681                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(lock->l_lvb_data, lvb_len);
01682                 if (lock->l_lvb_data == NULL)
01683                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01684         }
01685 
01686         lock->l_lvb_type = lvb_type;
01687         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_NEW_LOCK))
01688                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
01689 
01690         RETURN(lock);
01691 
01692 out:
01693         ldlm_lock_destroy(lock);
01694         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01695         RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
01696 }
01697 
01708 enum ldlm_error ldlm_lock_enqueue(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01709                                   struct ldlm_lock **lockp,
01710                                   void *cookie, __u64 *flags)
01711 {
01712         struct ldlm_lock *lock = *lockp;
01713         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
01714         int local = ns_is_client(ldlm_res_to_ns(res));
01715 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
01716         ldlm_processing_policy policy;
01717 #endif
01718         enum ldlm_error rc = ELDLM_OK;
01719         struct ldlm_interval *node = NULL;
01720         ENTRY;
01721 
01722         /* policies are not executed on the client or during replay */
01723         if ((*flags & (LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT|LDLM_FL_REPLAY)) == LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT
01724             && !local && ns->ns_policy) {
01725                 rc = ns->ns_policy(ns, lockp, cookie, lock->l_req_mode, *flags,
01726                                    NULL);
01727                 if (rc == ELDLM_LOCK_REPLACED) {
01728                         /* The lock that was returned has already been granted,
01729                          * and placed into lockp.  If it's not the same as the
01730                          * one we passed in, then destroy the old one and our
01731                          * work here is done. */
01732                         if (lock != *lockp) {
01733                                 ldlm_lock_destroy(lock);
01734                                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01735                         }
01736                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCK_CHANGED;
01737                         RETURN(0);
01738                 } else if (rc != ELDLM_OK &&
01739                            lock->l_req_mode == lock->l_granted_mode) {
01740                         LASSERT(*flags & LDLM_FL_RESENT);
01741                         /* It may happen that ns_policy returns an error in
01742                          * resend case, object may be unlinked or just some
01743                          * error occurs. It is unclear if lock reached the
01744                          * client in the original reply, just leave the lock on
01745                          * server, not returning it again to client. Due to
01746                          * LU-6529, the server will not OOM. */
01747                         RETURN(rc);
01748                 } else if (rc != ELDLM_OK ||
01749                            (rc == ELDLM_OK && (*flags & LDLM_FL_INTENT_ONLY))) {
01750                         ldlm_lock_destroy(lock);
01751                         RETURN(rc);
01752                 }
01753         }
01754 
01755         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_RESENT) {
01756                 /* Reconstruct LDLM_FL_SRV_ENQ_MASK @flags for reply.
01757                  * Set LOCK_CHANGED always.
01758                  * Check if the lock is granted for BLOCK_GRANTED.
01759                  * Take NO_TIMEOUT from the lock as it is inherited through
01760                  * LDLM_FL_INHERIT_MASK */
01761                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCK_CHANGED;
01762                 if (lock->l_req_mode != lock->l_granted_mode)
01763                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
01764                 *flags |= lock->l_flags & LDLM_FL_NO_TIMEOUT;
01765                 RETURN(ELDLM_OK);
01766         }
01767 
01768         /* For a replaying lock, it might be already in granted list. So
01769          * unlinking the lock will cause the interval node to be freed, we
01770          * have to allocate the interval node early otherwise we can't regrant
01771          * this lock in the future. - jay */
01772         if (!local && (*flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY) && res->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)
01773                 OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(node, ldlm_interval_slab, GFP_NOFS);
01774 
01775         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01776         if (local && lock->l_req_mode == lock->l_granted_mode) {
01777                 /* The server returned a blocked lock, but it was granted
01778                  * before we got a chance to actually enqueue it.  We don't
01779                  * need to do anything else. */
01780                 *flags &= ~LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK;
01781                 GOTO(out, rc = ELDLM_OK);
01782         }
01783 
01784         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
01785         if (res->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT && lock->l_tree_node == NULL) {
01786                 if (node == NULL) {
01787                         ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(lock);
01788                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01789                 }
01790 
01791                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&node->li_group);
01792                 ldlm_interval_attach(node, lock);
01793                 node = NULL;
01794         }
01795 
01796         /* Some flags from the enqueue want to make it into the AST, via the
01797          * lock's l_flags. */
01798         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_AST_DISCARD_DATA)
01799                 ldlm_set_ast_discard_data(lock);
01800         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
01801                 ldlm_set_test_lock(lock);
01802         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_COS_INCOMPAT)
01803                 ldlm_set_cos_incompat(lock);
01804         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_COS_ENABLED)
01805                 ldlm_set_cos_enabled(lock);
01806 
01807         /* This distinction between local lock trees is very important; a client
01808          * namespace only has information about locks taken by that client, and
01809          * thus doesn't have enough information to decide for itself if it can
01810          * be granted (below).  In this case, we do exactly what the server
01811          * tells us to do, as dictated by the 'flags'.
01812          *
01813          * We do exactly the same thing during recovery, when the server is
01814          * more or less trusting the clients not to lie.
01815          *
01816          * FIXME (bug 268): Detect obvious lies by checking compatibility in
01817          * granted/converting queues. */
01818         if (local) {
01819                 if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_CONV)
01820                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_converting, lock);
01821                 else if (*flags & (LDLM_FL_BLOCK_WAIT | LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED))
01822                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_waiting, lock);
01823                 else
01824                         ldlm_grant_lock(lock, NULL);
01825                 GOTO(out, rc = ELDLM_OK);
01826 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
01827         } else if (*flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY) {
01828                 if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_CONV) {
01829                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_converting, lock);
01830                         GOTO(out, rc = ELDLM_OK);
01831                 } else if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_WAIT) {
01832                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_waiting, lock);
01833                         GOTO(out, rc = ELDLM_OK);
01834                 } else if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED) {
01835                         ldlm_grant_lock(lock, NULL);
01836                         GOTO(out, rc = ELDLM_OK);
01837                 }
01838                 /* If no flags, fall through to normal enqueue path. */
01839         }
01840 
01841         policy = ldlm_processing_policy_table[res->lr_type];
01842         policy(lock, flags, 1, &rc, NULL);
01843         GOTO(out, rc);
01844 #else
01845         } else {
01846                 CERROR("This is client-side-only module, cannot handle "
01847                        "LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER resource type lock.\n");
01848                 LBUG();
01849         }
01850 #endif
01851 
01852 out:
01853         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01854         if (node)
01855                 OBD_SLAB_FREE(node, ldlm_interval_slab, sizeof(*node));
01856         return rc;
01857 }
01858 
01859 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
01860 
01866 int ldlm_reprocess_queue(struct ldlm_resource *res, struct list_head *queue,
01867                          struct list_head *work_list)
01868 {
01869         struct list_head *tmp, *pos;
01870         ldlm_processing_policy policy;
01871         __u64 flags;
01872         int rc = LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE;
01873         enum ldlm_error err;
01874         ENTRY;
01875 
01876         check_res_locked(res);
01877 
01878         policy = ldlm_processing_policy_table[res->lr_type];
01879         LASSERT(policy);
01880 
01881         list_for_each_safe(tmp, pos, queue) {
01882                 struct ldlm_lock *pending;
01883 
01884                 pending = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
01885 
01886                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Reprocessing lock %p\n", pending);
01887 
01888                 flags = 0;
01889                 rc = policy(pending, &flags, 0, &err, work_list);
01890                 if (rc != LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE)
01891                         break;
01892         }
01893 
01894         RETURN(rc);
01895 }
01896 #endif
01897 
01901 static int
01902 ldlm_work_bl_ast_lock(struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset, void *opaq)
01903 {
01904         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg *arg = opaq;
01905         struct ldlm_lock_desc   d;
01906         int                     rc;
01907         struct ldlm_lock       *lock;
01908         ENTRY;
01909 
01910         if (list_empty(arg->list))
01911                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
01912 
01913         lock = list_entry(arg->list->next, struct ldlm_lock, l_bl_ast);
01914 
01915         /* nobody should touch l_bl_ast */
01916         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01917         list_del_init(&lock->l_bl_ast);
01918 
01919         LASSERT(ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock));
01920         LASSERT(lock->l_bl_ast_run == 0);
01921         LASSERT(lock->l_blocking_lock);
01922         lock->l_bl_ast_run++;
01923         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01924 
01925         ldlm_lock2desc(lock->l_blocking_lock, &d);
01926 
01927         rc = lock->l_blocking_ast(lock, &d, (void *)arg, LDLM_CB_BLOCKING);
01928         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock->l_blocking_lock);
01929         lock->l_blocking_lock = NULL;
01930         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01931 
01932         RETURN(rc);
01933 }
01934 
01938 static int
01939 ldlm_work_cp_ast_lock(struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset, void *opaq)
01940 {
01941         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg  *arg = opaq;
01942         int                      rc = 0;
01943         struct ldlm_lock        *lock;
01944         ldlm_completion_callback completion_callback;
01945         ENTRY;
01946 
01947         if (list_empty(arg->list))
01948                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
01949 
01950         lock = list_entry(arg->list->next, struct ldlm_lock, l_cp_ast);
01951 
01952         /* It's possible to receive a completion AST before we've set
01953          * the l_completion_ast pointer: either because the AST arrived
01954          * before the reply, or simply because there's a small race
01955          * window between receiving the reply and finishing the local
01956          * enqueue. (bug 842)
01957          *
01958          * This can't happen with the blocking_ast, however, because we
01959          * will never call the local blocking_ast until we drop our
01960          * reader/writer reference, which we won't do until we get the
01961          * reply and finish enqueueing. */
01962 
01963         /* nobody should touch l_cp_ast */
01964         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01965         list_del_init(&lock->l_cp_ast);
01966         LASSERT(ldlm_is_cp_reqd(lock));
01967         /* save l_completion_ast since it can be changed by
01968          * mds_intent_policy(), see bug 14225 */
01969         completion_callback = lock->l_completion_ast;
01970         ldlm_clear_cp_reqd(lock);
01971         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01972 
01973         if (completion_callback != NULL)
01974                 rc = completion_callback(lock, 0, (void *)arg);
01975         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01976 
01977         RETURN(rc);
01978 }
01979 
01983 static int
01984 ldlm_work_revoke_ast_lock(struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset, void *opaq)
01985 {
01986         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg *arg = opaq;
01987         struct ldlm_lock_desc   desc;
01988         int                     rc;
01989         struct ldlm_lock       *lock;
01990         ENTRY;
01991 
01992         if (list_empty(arg->list))
01993                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
01994 
01995         lock = list_entry(arg->list->next, struct ldlm_lock, l_rk_ast);
01996         list_del_init(&lock->l_rk_ast);
01997 
01998         /* the desc just pretend to exclusive */
01999         ldlm_lock2desc(lock, &desc);
02000         desc.l_req_mode = LCK_EX;
02001         desc.l_granted_mode = 0;
02002 
02003         rc = lock->l_blocking_ast(lock, &desc, (void*)arg, LDLM_CB_BLOCKING);
02004         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02005 
02006         RETURN(rc);
02007 }
02008 
02012 int ldlm_work_gl_ast_lock(struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset, void *opaq)
02013 {
02014         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg          *arg = opaq;
02015         struct ldlm_glimpse_work        *gl_work;
02016         struct ldlm_lock                *lock;
02017         int                              rc = 0;
02018         ENTRY;
02019 
02020         if (list_empty(arg->list))
02021                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
02022 
02023         gl_work = list_entry(arg->list->next, struct ldlm_glimpse_work,
02024                                  gl_list);
02025         list_del_init(&gl_work->gl_list);
02026 
02027         lock = gl_work->gl_lock;
02028 
02029         /* transfer the glimpse descriptor to ldlm_cb_set_arg */
02030         arg->gl_desc = gl_work->gl_desc;
02031 
02032         /* invoke the actual glimpse callback */
02033         if (lock->l_glimpse_ast(lock, (void*)arg) == 0)
02034                 rc = 1;
02035 
02036         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02037 
02038         if ((gl_work->gl_flags & LDLM_GL_WORK_NOFREE) == 0)
02039                 OBD_FREE_PTR(gl_work);
02040 
02041         RETURN(rc);
02042 }
02043 
02050 int ldlm_run_ast_work(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct list_head *rpc_list,
02051                       ldlm_desc_ast_t ast_type)
02052 {
02053         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg *arg;
02054         set_producer_func       work_ast_lock;
02055         int                     rc;
02056 
02057         if (list_empty(rpc_list))
02058                 RETURN(0);
02059 
02060         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(arg);
02061         if (arg == NULL)
02062                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02063 
02064         atomic_set(&arg->restart, 0);
02065         arg->list = rpc_list;
02066 
02067         switch (ast_type) {
02068                 case LDLM_WORK_BL_AST:
02069                         arg->type = LDLM_BL_CALLBACK;
02070                         work_ast_lock = ldlm_work_bl_ast_lock;
02071                         break;
02072                 case LDLM_WORK_CP_AST:
02073                         arg->type = LDLM_CP_CALLBACK;
02074                         work_ast_lock = ldlm_work_cp_ast_lock;
02075                         break;
02076                 case LDLM_WORK_REVOKE_AST:
02077                         arg->type = LDLM_BL_CALLBACK;
02078                         work_ast_lock = ldlm_work_revoke_ast_lock;
02079                         break;
02080                 case LDLM_WORK_GL_AST:
02081                         arg->type = LDLM_GL_CALLBACK;
02082                         work_ast_lock = ldlm_work_gl_ast_lock;
02083                         break;
02084                 default:
02085                         LBUG();
02086         }
02087 
02088         /* We create a ptlrpc request set with flow control extension.
02089          * This request set will use the work_ast_lock function to produce new
02090          * requests and will send a new request each time one completes in order
02091          * to keep the number of requests in flight to ns_max_parallel_ast */
02092         arg->set = ptlrpc_prep_fcset(ns->ns_max_parallel_ast ? : UINT_MAX,
02093                                      work_ast_lock, arg);
02094         if (arg->set == NULL)
02095                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
02096 
02097         ptlrpc_set_wait(arg->set);
02098         ptlrpc_set_destroy(arg->set);
02099 
02100         rc = atomic_read(&arg->restart) ? -ERESTART : 0;
02101         GOTO(out, rc);
02102 out:
02103         OBD_FREE_PTR(arg);
02104         return rc;
02105 }
02106 
02107 static int reprocess_one_queue(struct ldlm_resource *res, void *closure)
02108 {
02109         ldlm_reprocess_all(res);
02110         return LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE;
02111 }
02112 
02113 static int ldlm_reprocess_res(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
02114                               struct hlist_node *hnode, void *arg)
02115 {
02116         struct ldlm_resource *res = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
02117         int    rc;
02118 
02119         rc = reprocess_one_queue(res, arg);
02120 
02121         return rc == LDLM_ITER_STOP;
02122 }
02123 
02128 void ldlm_reprocess_all_ns(struct ldlm_namespace *ns)
02129 {
02130         ENTRY;
02131 
02132         if (ns != NULL) {
02133                 cfs_hash_for_each_nolock(ns->ns_rs_hash,
02134                                          ldlm_reprocess_res, NULL, 0);
02135         }
02136         EXIT;
02137 }
02138 
02147 void ldlm_reprocess_all(struct ldlm_resource *res)
02148 {
02149         struct list_head rpc_list;
02150 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02151         int rc;
02152         ENTRY;
02153 
02154         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
02155         /* Local lock trees don't get reprocessed. */
02156         if (ns_is_client(ldlm_res_to_ns(res))) {
02157                 EXIT;
02158                 return;
02159         }
02160 
02161 restart:
02162         lock_res(res);
02163         rc = ldlm_reprocess_queue(res, &res->lr_converting, &rpc_list);
02164         if (rc == LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE)
02165                 ldlm_reprocess_queue(res, &res->lr_waiting, &rpc_list);
02166         unlock_res(res);
02167 
02168         rc = ldlm_run_ast_work(ldlm_res_to_ns(res), &rpc_list,
02169                                LDLM_WORK_CP_AST);
02170         if (rc == -ERESTART) {
02171                 LASSERT(list_empty(&rpc_list));
02172                 goto restart;
02173         }
02174 #else
02175         ENTRY;
02176 
02177         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
02178         if (!ns_is_client(ldlm_res_to_ns(res))) {
02179                 CERROR("This is client-side-only module, cannot handle "
02180                        "LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER resource type lock.\n");
02181                 LBUG();
02182         }
02183 #endif
02184         EXIT;
02185 }
02186 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_reprocess_all);
02187 
02188 static bool is_bl_done(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02189 {
02190         bool bl_done = true;
02191 
02192         if (!ldlm_is_bl_done(lock)) {
02193                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02194                 bl_done = ldlm_is_bl_done(lock);
02195                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02196         }
02197 
02198         return bl_done;
02199 }
02200 
02205 void ldlm_cancel_callback(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02206 {
02207         check_res_locked(lock->l_resource);
02208         if (!ldlm_is_cancel(lock)) {
02209                 ldlm_set_cancel(lock);
02210                 if (lock->l_blocking_ast) {
02211                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02212                         lock->l_blocking_ast(lock, NULL, lock->l_ast_data,
02213                                              LDLM_CB_CANCELING);
02214                         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02215                 } else {
02216                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "no blocking ast");
02217                 }
02218 
02219                 /* only canceller can set bl_done bit */
02220                 ldlm_set_bl_done(lock);
02221                 wake_up_all(&lock->l_waitq);
02222         } else if (!ldlm_is_bl_done(lock)) {
02223                 struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
02224 
02225                 /* The lock is guaranteed to have been canceled once
02226                  * returning from this function. */
02227                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02228                 l_wait_event(lock->l_waitq, is_bl_done(lock), &lwi);
02229                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02230         }
02231 }
02232 
02236 void ldlm_unlink_lock_skiplist(struct ldlm_lock *req)
02237 {
02238         if (req->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_PLAIN &&
02239             req->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_IBITS)
02240                 return;
02241 
02242         list_del_init(&req->l_sl_policy);
02243         list_del_init(&req->l_sl_mode);
02244 }
02245 
02249 void ldlm_lock_cancel(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02250 {
02251         struct ldlm_resource *res;
02252         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
02253         ENTRY;
02254 
02255         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02256 
02257         res = lock->l_resource;
02258         ns  = ldlm_res_to_ns(res);
02259 
02260         /* Please do not, no matter how tempting, remove this LBUG without
02261          * talking to me first. -phik */
02262         if (lock->l_readers || lock->l_writers) {
02263                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock still has references");
02264                 LBUG();
02265         }
02266 
02267         if (ldlm_is_waited(lock))
02268                 ldlm_del_waiting_lock(lock);
02269 
02270         /* Releases cancel callback. */
02271         ldlm_cancel_callback(lock);
02272 
02273         LASSERT(!ldlm_is_waited(lock));
02274 
02275         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
02276         ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(lock);
02277 
02278         if (lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode)
02279                 ldlm_pool_del(&ns->ns_pool, lock);
02280 
02281         /* Make sure we will not be called again for same lock what is possible
02282          * if not to zero out lock->l_granted_mode */
02283         lock->l_granted_mode = LCK_MINMODE;
02284         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02285 
02286         EXIT;
02287 }
02288 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_cancel);
02289 
02293 int ldlm_lock_set_data(const struct lustre_handle *lockh, void *data)
02294 {
02295         struct ldlm_lock *lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
02296         int rc = -EINVAL;
02297         ENTRY;
02298 
02299         if (lock) {
02300                 if (lock->l_ast_data == NULL)
02301                         lock->l_ast_data = data;
02302                 if (lock->l_ast_data == data)
02303                         rc = 0;
02304                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02305         }
02306         RETURN(rc);
02307 }
02308 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_set_data);
02309 
02310 struct export_cl_data {
02311         struct obd_export       *ecl_exp;
02312         int                     ecl_loop;
02313 };
02314 
02315 static void ldlm_cancel_lock_for_export(struct obd_export *exp,
02316                                         struct ldlm_lock *lock,
02317                                         struct export_cl_data *ecl)
02318 {
02319         struct ldlm_resource *res;
02320 
02321         res = ldlm_resource_getref(lock->l_resource);
02322 
02323         ldlm_res_lvbo_update(res, NULL, 1);
02324         ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
02325         if (!exp->exp_obd->obd_stopping)
02326                 ldlm_reprocess_all(res);
02327         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
02328 
02329         ecl->ecl_loop++;
02330         if ((ecl->ecl_loop & -ecl->ecl_loop) == ecl->ecl_loop) {
02331                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Export %p, %d locks cancelled.\n",
02332                        exp, ecl->ecl_loop);
02333         }
02334 }
02335 
02340 static int
02341 ldlm_cancel_locks_for_export_cb(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
02342                                 struct hlist_node *hnode, void *data)
02343 
02344 {
02345         struct export_cl_data   *ecl = (struct export_cl_data *)data;
02346         struct obd_export       *exp  = ecl->ecl_exp;
02347         struct ldlm_lock        *lock = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
02348 
02349         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
02350         ldlm_cancel_lock_for_export(exp, lock, ecl);
02351         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02352 
02353         return 0;
02354 }
02355 
02361 int ldlm_export_cancel_blocked_locks(struct obd_export *exp)
02362 {
02363         struct export_cl_data   ecl = {
02364                 .ecl_exp        = exp,
02365                 .ecl_loop       = 0,
02366         };
02367 
02368         while (!list_empty(&exp->exp_bl_list)) {
02369                 struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02370 
02371                 spin_lock_bh(&exp->exp_bl_list_lock);
02372                 if (!list_empty(&exp->exp_bl_list)) {
02373                         lock = list_entry(exp->exp_bl_list.next,
02374                                           struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_list);
02375                         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
02376                         list_del_init(&lock->l_exp_list);
02377                 } else {
02378                         lock = NULL;
02379                 }
02380                 spin_unlock_bh(&exp->exp_bl_list_lock);
02381 
02382                 if (lock == NULL)
02383                         break;
02384 
02385                 ldlm_cancel_lock_for_export(exp, lock, &ecl);
02386                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02387         }
02388 
02389         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Export %p, canceled %d locks, "
02390                "left on hash table %d.\n", exp, ecl.ecl_loop,
02391                atomic_read(&exp->exp_lock_hash->hs_count));
02392 
02393         return ecl.ecl_loop;
02394 }
02395 
02401 int ldlm_export_cancel_locks(struct obd_export *exp)
02402 {
02403         struct export_cl_data   ecl = {
02404                 .ecl_exp        = exp,
02405                 .ecl_loop       = 0,
02406         };
02407 
02408         cfs_hash_for_each_empty(exp->exp_lock_hash,
02409                                 ldlm_cancel_locks_for_export_cb, &ecl);
02410 
02411         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Export %p, canceled %d locks, "
02412                "left on hash table %d.\n", exp, ecl.ecl_loop,
02413                atomic_read(&exp->exp_lock_hash->hs_count));
02414
