02415         return ecl.ecl_loop;
02416 }
02417 
02428 void ldlm_lock_downgrade(struct ldlm_lock *lock, enum ldlm_mode new_mode)
02429 {
02430         ENTRY;
02431 
02432         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode & (LCK_PW | LCK_EX));
02433         LASSERT(new_mode == LCK_COS);
02434 
02435         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02436         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
02437         /*
02438          * Remove the lock from pool as it will be added again in
02439          * ldlm_grant_lock() called below.
02440          */
02441         ldlm_pool_del(&ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock)->ns_pool, lock);
02442 
02443         lock->l_req_mode = new_mode;
02444         ldlm_grant_lock(lock, NULL);
02445         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02446         ldlm_reprocess_all(lock->l_resource);
02447 
02448         EXIT;
02449 }
02450 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_downgrade);
02451 
02459 struct ldlm_resource *ldlm_lock_convert(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
02460                                         enum ldlm_mode new_mode, __u32 *flags)
02461 {
02462         struct list_head rpc_list;
02463         struct ldlm_resource *res;
02464         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
02465         int granted = 0;
02466 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02467         int old_mode;
02468         struct sl_insert_point prev;
02469 #endif
02470         struct ldlm_interval *node;
02471         ENTRY;
02472 
02473         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
02474         /* Just return if mode is unchanged. */
02475         if (new_mode == lock->l_granted_mode) {
02476                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
02477                 RETURN(lock->l_resource);
02478         }
02479 
02480         /* I can't check the type of lock here because the bitlock of lock
02481          * is not held here, so do the allocation blindly. -jay */
02482         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(node, ldlm_interval_slab, GFP_NOFS);
02483         if (node == NULL)  /* Actually, this causes EDEADLOCK to be returned */
02484                 RETURN(NULL);
02485 
02486         LASSERTF((new_mode == LCK_PW && lock->l_granted_mode == LCK_PR),
02487                  "new_mode %u, granted %u\n", new_mode, lock->l_granted_mode);
02488 
02489         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02490 
02491         res = lock->l_resource;
02492         ns  = ldlm_res_to_ns(res);
02493 
02494 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02495         old_mode = lock->l_req_mode;
02496 #endif
02497         lock->l_req_mode = new_mode;
02498         if (res->lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN || res->lr_type == LDLM_IBITS) {
02499 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02500                 /* remember the lock position where the lock might be
02501                  * added back to the granted list later and also
02502                  * remember the join mode for skiplist fixing. */
02503                 prev.res_link = lock->l_res_link.prev;
02504                 prev.mode_link = lock->l_sl_mode.prev;
02505                 prev.policy_link = lock->l_sl_policy.prev;
02506 #endif
02507                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
02508         } else {
02509                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
02510                 if (res->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT) {
02511                         /* FIXME: ugly code, I have to attach the lock to a
02512                          * interval node again since perhaps it will be granted
02513                          * soon */
02514                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&node->li_group);
02515                         ldlm_interval_attach(node, lock);
02516                         node = NULL;
02517                 }
02518         }
02519 
02520         /*
02521          * Remove old lock from the pool before adding the lock with new
02522          * mode below in ->policy()
02523          */
02524         ldlm_pool_del(&ns->ns_pool, lock);
02525 
02526         /* If this is a local resource, put it on the appropriate list. */
02527         if (ns_is_client(ldlm_res_to_ns(res))) {
02528                 if (*flags & (LDLM_FL_BLOCK_CONV | LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED)) {
02529                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_converting, lock);
02530                 } else {
02531                         /* This should never happen, because of the way the
02532                          * server handles conversions. */
02533                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Erroneous flags %x on local lock\n",
02534                                    *flags);
02535                         LBUG();
02536 
02537                         ldlm_grant_lock(lock, &rpc_list);
02538                         granted = 1;
02539                         /* FIXME: completion handling not with lr_lock held ! */
02540                         if (lock->l_completion_ast)
02541                                 lock->l_completion_ast(lock, 0, NULL);
02542                 }
02543 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02544         } else {
02545                 int rc;
02546                 enum ldlm_error err;
02547                 __u64 pflags = 0;
02548                 ldlm_processing_policy policy;
02549 
02550                 policy = ldlm_processing_policy_table[res->lr_type];
02551                 rc = policy(lock, &pflags, 0, &err, &rpc_list);
02552                 if (rc == LDLM_ITER_STOP) {
02553                         lock->l_req_mode = old_mode;
02554                         if (res->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)
02555                                 ldlm_extent_add_lock(res, lock);
02556                         else
02557                                 ldlm_granted_list_add_lock(lock, &prev);
02558 
02559                         res = NULL;
02560                 } else {
02561                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
02562                         granted = 1;
02563                 }
02564         }
02565 #else
02566         } else {
02567                 CERROR("This is client-side-only module, cannot handle "
02568                        "LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER resource type lock.\n");
02569                 LBUG();
02570         }
02571 #endif
02572         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02573 
02574         if (granted)
02575                 ldlm_run_ast_work(ns, &rpc_list, LDLM_WORK_CP_AST);
02576         if (node)
02577                 OBD_SLAB_FREE(node, ldlm_interval_slab, sizeof(*node));
02578         RETURN(res);
02579 }
02580 
02586 void ldlm_lock_dump_handle(int level, const struct lustre_handle *lockh)
02587 {
02588         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02589 
02590         if (!((libcfs_debug | D_ERROR) & level))
02591                 return;
02592 
02593         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
02594         if (lock == NULL)
02595                 return;
02596 
02597         LDLM_DEBUG_LIMIT(level, lock, "###");
02598 
02599         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02600 }
02601 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_lock_dump_handle);
02602 
02607 void _ldlm_lock_debug(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
02608                       struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata,
02609                       const char *fmt, ...)
02610 {
02611         va_list args;
02612         struct obd_export *exp = lock->l_export;
02613         struct ldlm_resource *resource = lock->l_resource;
02614         char *nid = "local";
02615 
02616         va_start(args, fmt);
02617 
02618         if (exp && exp->exp_connection) {
02619                 nid = libcfs_nid2str(exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid);
02620         } else if (exp && exp->exp_obd != NULL) {
02621                 struct obd_import *imp = exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
02622                 nid = libcfs_nid2str(imp->imp_connection->c_peer.nid);
02623         }
02624 
02625         if (resource == NULL) {
02626                 libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
02627                        " ns: \?\? lock: %p/"LPX64" lrc: %d/%d,%d mode: %s/%s "
02628                        "res: \?\? rrc=\?\? type: \?\?\? flags: "LPX64" nid: %s "
02629                        "remote: "LPX64" expref: %d pid: %u timeout: %lu "
02630                        "lvb_type: %d\n",
02631                        lock,
02632                        lock->l_handle.h_cookie, atomic_read(&lock->l_refc),
02633                        lock->l_readers, lock->l_writers,
02634                        ldlm_lockname[lock->l_granted_mode],
02635                        ldlm_lockname[lock->l_req_mode],
02636                        lock->l_flags, nid, lock->l_remote_handle.cookie,
02637                        exp ? atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount) : -99,
02638                        lock->l_pid, lock->l_callback_timeout, lock->l_lvb_type);
02639                 va_end(args);
02640                 return;
02641         }
02642 
02643         switch (resource->lr_type) {
02644         case LDLM_EXTENT:
02645                 libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
02646                         " ns: %s lock: %p/"LPX64" lrc: %d/%d,%d mode: %s/%s "
02647                         "res: "DLDLMRES" rrc: %d type: %s ["LPU64"->"LPU64"] "
02648                         "(req "LPU64"->"LPU64") flags: "LPX64" nid: %s remote: "
02649                         LPX64" expref: %d pid: %u timeout: %lu lvb_type: %d\n",
02650                         ldlm_lock_to_ns_name(lock), lock,
02651                         lock->l_handle.h_cookie, atomic_read(&lock->l_refc),
02652                         lock->l_readers, lock->l_writers,
02653                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_granted_mode],
02654                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_req_mode],
02655                         PLDLMRES(resource),
02656                         atomic_read(&resource->lr_refcount),
02657                         ldlm_typename[resource->lr_type],
02658                         lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start,
02659                         lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end,
02660                         lock->l_req_extent.start, lock->l_req_extent.end,
02661                         lock->l_flags, nid, lock->l_remote_handle.cookie,
02662                         exp ? atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount) : -99,
02663                         lock->l_pid, lock->l_callback_timeout,
02664                         lock->l_lvb_type);
02665                 break;
02666 
02667         case LDLM_FLOCK:
02668                 libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
02669                         " ns: %s lock: %p/"LPX64" lrc: %d/%d,%d mode: %s/%s "
02670                         "res: "DLDLMRES" rrc: %d type: %s pid: %d "
02671                         "["LPU64"->"LPU64"] flags: "LPX64" nid: %s "
02672                         "remote: "LPX64" expref: %d pid: %u timeout: %lu\n",
02673                         ldlm_lock_to_ns_name(lock), lock,
02674                         lock->l_handle.h_cookie, atomic_read(&lock->l_refc),
02675                         lock->l_readers, lock->l_writers,
02676                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_granted_mode],
02677                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_req_mode],
02678                         PLDLMRES(resource),
02679                         atomic_read(&resource->lr_refcount),
02680                         ldlm_typename[resource->lr_type],
02681                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.pid,
02682                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.start,
02683                         lock->l_policy_data.l_flock.end,
02684                         lock->l_flags, nid, lock->l_remote_handle.cookie,
02685                         exp ? atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount) : -99,
02686                         lock->l_pid, lock->l_callback_timeout);
02687                 break;
02688 
02689         case LDLM_IBITS:
02690                 libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
02691                         " ns: %s lock: %p/"LPX64" lrc: %d/%d,%d mode: %s/%s "
02692                         "res: "DLDLMRES" bits "LPX64" rrc: %d type: %s "
02693                         "flags: "LPX64" nid: %s remote: "LPX64" expref: %d "
02694                         "pid: %u timeout: %lu lvb_type: %d\n",
02695                         ldlm_lock_to_ns_name(lock),
02696                         lock, lock->l_handle.h_cookie,
02697                         atomic_read(&lock->l_refc),
02698                         lock->l_readers, lock->l_writers,
02699                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_granted_mode],
02700                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_req_mode],
02701                         PLDLMRES(resource),
02702                         lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits,
02703                         atomic_read(&resource->lr_refcount),
02704                         ldlm_typename[resource->lr_type],
02705                         lock->l_flags, nid, lock->l_remote_handle.cookie,
02706                         exp ? atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount) : -99,
02707                         lock->l_pid, lock->l_callback_timeout,
02708                         lock->l_lvb_type);
02709                 break;
02710 
02711         default:
02712                 libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
02713                         " ns: %s lock: %p/"LPX64" lrc: %d/%d,%d mode: %s/%s "
02714                         "res: "DLDLMRES" rrc: %d type: %s flags: "LPX64" "
02715                         "nid: %s remote: "LPX64" expref: %d pid: %u "
02716                         "timeout: %lu lvb_type: %d\n",
02717                         ldlm_lock_to_ns_name(lock),
02718                         lock, lock->l_handle.h_cookie,
02719                         atomic_read(&lock->l_refc),
02720                         lock->l_readers, lock->l_writers,
02721                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_granted_mode],
02722                         ldlm_lockname[lock->l_req_mode],
02723                         PLDLMRES(resource),
02724                         atomic_read(&resource->lr_refcount),
02725                         ldlm_typename[resource->lr_type],
02726                         lock->l_flags, nid, lock->l_remote_handle.cookie,
02727                         exp ? atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount) : -99,
02728                         lock->l_pid, lock->l_callback_timeout,
02729                         lock->l_lvb_type);
02730                 break;
02731         }
02732         va_end(args);
02733 }
02734 EXPORT_SYMBOL(_ldlm_lock_debug);
